metadata.title: CVE-2021-38093 on Ubuntu 22.10 (kinetic) - medium.
metadata.description:
Integer Overflow vulnerability in function filter_robert in libavfilter/vf_convolution.c in Ffmpeg 4.2.1, allows attackers to cause a Denial of Service or other unspecified impacts.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-38093` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ffmpeg - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavcodec-extra59 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavcodec59 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavdevice59 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavfilter-extra8 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavfilter8 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavformat-extra - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavformat-extra59 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavformat59 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libavutil57 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libpostproc56 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libswresample4 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
libswscale6 - 7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1
No subscription required

notes.note: ebarretto> ffmpeg: same fix as CVE-2020-20898

criterions.comment: ffmpeg package in kinetic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '7:4.3.1-4ubuntu1').
qtwebengine-opensource-src package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
vice package in kinetic is affected and may need fixing.
